question: What should I do if my set-top box can't connect to Wi-Fi?
answer: Check if the Wi-Fi password is correct. Restart the set-top box and the router. Make sure the router is within range and broadcasting.

question: Why is my internet slow on the Android TV box?
answer: Slow speed can be due to weak Wi-Fi signal, network congestion, or outdated firmware. Try switching to 5GHz Wi-Fi or using an Ethernet cable if available.

question: How do I reset the Wi-Fi settings on my STB?
answer: Go to Settings > Network > Wi-Fi, select your current network, and choose 'Forget'. Then reconnect by entering the password again.

question: Why does the set-top box disconnect from Wi-Fi randomly?
answer: This may be caused by unstable signal strength, interference from other devices, or power-saving settings. Try moving the router closer and disabling any sleep modes.

question: Can I use an Ethernet connection instead of Wi-Fi?
answer: Yes, if your STB has an Ethernet port, connect it directly to the router using a LAN cable for more stable performance.

question: How do I check if the STB has internet access?
answer: Go to Settings > Network. If connected, it will show 'Connected' under the selected network. You can also test internet access by opening any streaming app.

question: Why does my STB say 'Connected, no internet'?
answer: The STB is connected to the router but can't reach the internet. Restart your router and check if other devices can access the internet.

question: Why is there no signal on my TV when using HDMI?
answer: Ensure the HDMI cable is securely connected to both the set-top box and the TV. Also, verify that the TV is set to the correct HDMI input source.

question: What should I do if the screen is black after turning on the STB?
answer: Try unplugging the HDMI cable and plugging it back in. If the screen stays black, restart both the STB and the TV.

question: Why is the video flickering or cutting out over HDMI?
answer: This could be caused by a loose or damaged HDMI cable. Try using a different cable or port. Also, make sure the HDMI cable supports the resolution output of the STB.

question: Can I use an HDMI to VGA adapter with my STB?
answer: HDMI to VGA adapters require an active converter with power. Check that the adapter is powered and supports the resolution output of the STB.

question: What HDMI version is required for 4K output?
answer: For stable 4K output, use an HDMI 2.0 or higher cable and ensure the TV also supports HDMI 2.0 or higher.

question: Why is there no audio through the HDMI connection?
answer: Go to Settings > Audio Output and confirm that 'HDMI' is selected as the output mode. Also, make sure the TV volume is not muted.

question: What should I do if the STB display is not fitting correctly on the screen?
answer: Adjust the display settings under Settings > Display > Screen Position or Zoom to fit the screen properly.

question: Why is there no sound from my set-top box?
answer: Check the volume on your TV and STB. Ensure the audio cable or HDMI is connected properly. Go to Settings > Audio and make sure the output is not set to 'Off' or 'SPDIF only' if you're using HDMI.

question: What should I do if sound cuts in and out?
answer: Intermittent sound may be caused by a loose HDMI or optical cable. Try reseating the cable or using a different one. Also check audio settings for format compatibility.

question: Why is the audio out of sync with video?
answer: Go to Settings > Audio and try adjusting the audio delay if available. Also check if enabling or disabling hardware decoding affects sync.

question: How do I enable Dolby Digital audio on my STB?
answer: Go to Settings > Audio and select 'Dolby Digital' or 'Dolby Digital Plus' as the audio output format. Make sure your TV or sound system supports Dolby decoding.

question: Does my set-top box support Dolby Atmos?
answer: Dolby Atmos is supported only if your STB firmware and hardware support it. Check with your device manufacturer or refer to the system info under Settings > About.

question: Why do I hear no sound when Dolby is enabled?
answer: Your TV or receiver may not support the selected Dolby format. Try switching to PCM or standard stereo in the audio settings.

question: Can I force stereo output instead of Dolby?
answer: Yes. Go to Settings > Audio Output and set the mode to 'PCM' or 'Stereo' to disable Dolby processing.

question: Why is Dolby Vision not working on my TV?
answer: Ensure both your TV and HDMI cable support Dolby Vision. Go to Settings > Display > HDR Format and verify Dolby Vision is enabled. Use HDMI 2.0 or higher.

question: How do I enable Dolby Vision on my set-top box?
answer: Go to Settings > Display > HDR Format and select 'Dolby Vision'. Your TV must support Dolby Vision and be connected via a compatible HDMI port.

question: Does my set-top box support HDR10+?
answer: Check Settings > Display > HDR Format. If HDR10+ is listed, your box supports it. HDR10+ content also requires a compatible TV and app.

question: Why is HDR not triggering on my TV?
answer: Make sure HDR is enabled in Settings > Display > HDR Format. Confirm the app and content support HDR, and that your TV HDMI input is configured for enhanced mode.

question: Can I force SDR output instead of HDR?
answer: Yes. Go to Settings > Display and set the HDR Format to 'SDR' or disable 'HDR Auto-detection'. This can help with compatibility issues.

question: Why does my screen look washed out when HDR is on?
answer: This could be due to incorrect tone mapping or an unsupported HDR format. Try switching between HDR10, HDR10+, or Dolby Vision to match your TV's capabilities.

question: Is HDR available on all apps?
answer: No, only specific apps and content support HDR. Check if the app or video explicitly states HDR, Dolby Vision, or HDR10+ support.

question: How do I install new apps on my Android TV set-top box?
answer: Open the Google Play Store app on your STB, search for the app you want, and select 'Install'.

question: Why can’t I find Netflix or YouTube on my STB?
answer: Some apps may not be available if your STB is not certified. Check with the manufacturer or update the firmware. You may also need to update Google Play Services.

question: How do I clear cache for an app?
answer: Go to Settings > Apps > Select the app > Clear Cache. This can help fix app freezing or crashing issues.

question: Why do apps crash or freeze on my STB?
answer: Apps may crash due to low memory, outdated versions, or bugs. Try clearing cache, reinstalling the app, or updating your STB firmware.

question: How do I update the software on my STB?
answer: Go to Settings > Device Preferences > About > System Update. Follow the prompts to check and install updates.

question: Why is my remote control not working?
answer: Replace the batteries and ensure the remote is paired with the STB. For Bluetooth remotes, go to Settings > Remotes & Accessories to re-pair.

question: How do I pair a Bluetooth remote or game controller?
answer: Go to Settings > Remotes & Accessories > Add Accessory. Put the device in pairing mode and select it from the list.

question: What should I do if there is no response when I press buttons on the remote?
answer: Check if the LED on the remote flashes when pressing buttons. If not, replace batteries. If yes, try re-pairing or restarting the STB.

question: Why does the STB feel slow or laggy?
answer: Too many apps running in the background can slow it down. Close unused apps, clear cache, or restart the STB.

question: How do I free up storage on my STB?
answer: Go to Settings > Storage. Uninstall unused apps or move apps to external storage if supported.

question: Can I connect external USB storage to my STB?
answer: Yes, if your STB has a USB port. Go to Settings > Storage and format the USB drive as internal or external storage.

question: How do I restart or factory reset my STB?
answer: Restart: Hold the power button on the remote or unplug and plug back in. Factory reset: Go to Settings > Device Preferences > Reset > Factory data reset.

question: Why does my STB not turn on?
answer: Check the power cable and adapter. Try plugging into another outlet. If the LED does not light up, the power supply may be faulty.

question: How do I enable developer options on my STB?
answer: Go to Settings > Device Preferences > About > Build number. Tap 'Build number' 7 times to enable Developer Options.

question: Can I connect a Bluetooth headset to my STB?
answer: Yes. Go to Settings > Remotes & Accessories > Add Accessory. Put your headset in pairing mode and select it.

question: Why is Google Assistant not working on my STB?
answer: Check if the remote has a mic button and is paired correctly. Make sure the STB is connected to the internet and that Google Assistant is enabled in Settings.

question: How do I cast from my phone to the STB?
answer: Ensure your phone and STB are on the same Wi-Fi network. Open a Cast-enabled app on your phone and select your STB from the cast menu.

question: Why is screen casting laggy?
answer: Lag can be caused by weak Wi-Fi. Use a 5GHz network or Ethernet connection for better performance.

question: How do I enable subtitles or closed captions?
answer: During playback, press the remote’s menu or CC button if available, or go to Settings > Device Preferences > Accessibility > Captions.
